Hi Ben,

I think you can use the new JUnit Testcase Dialog to specify the "=
class
under test" and the methods to test.

Afterwards you can use MoreUnit=
, for example. CTRL-U generates a stub for
the current method, and CTRL-J j=
umps between production code and test case.
http://moreunit.sourceforge.net=
/

Regards,
Murat




2010/10/28 Ben Stover <bxstover@...>

orry for this newbie question:
